metadata.feature_description: Wiki functionality within DNN social groups with group-specific content

steps.action: Navigate to Test Activity Group Wiki tab
steps.expected: Group wiki page loads with article list
steps.actual: Group wiki page loaded successfully showing existing articles
Create article dialog opened with title, type, content, and tags fields

steps.action: Fill article form with title, content, and tags
steps.actual: Form filled with title 'Group Integration Test - Jan 16 2026', content, and tags 'group-mode-test, integration-test'

steps.expected: Article is created and published in the group
steps.actual: Article was created successfully and browser navigated to article detail page. User points increased from 218 to 223.

steps.action: Navigate to group wiki article list
steps.expected: Group wiki list displays articles specific to this group
steps.actual: Article list shows 8 articles, all with URLs containing groupid/9 confirming group-specific content

steps.action: Verify newly created article appears in list
steps.expected: Article 'Group Integration Test - Jan 16 2026' appears in the list
steps.actual: Newly created article appears at top of list sorted by last active, showing tags and View Full Page link

steps.action: Click Edit button on group wiki article
steps.expected: Edit dialog opens for authorized user
steps.actual: Edit dialog opened successfully showing content editor with Cancel, Delete, and Publish buttons

steps.expected: Edit and Delete options visible for group member
steps.actual: Edit and Delete buttons are visible and functional, confirming user has appropriate permissions

steps.action: Locate Subscriptions section on group wiki page
steps.actual: Subscriptions section visible with 'Unsubscribe from Articles' link indicating user is subscribed
Link changed to 'Subscribe to new Articles' confirming unsubscribe worked

steps.expected: Subscription toggle changes back to Unsubscribe
steps.actual: Link changed back to 'Unsubscribe from Articles' confirming subscribe worked

steps.expected: Activity stream displays with wiki article entries
steps.actual: Activity tab loaded showing journal entries including wiki article creations

steps.action: Verify wiki article appears in activity journal
steps.expected: Entry shows 'authored wiki article Group Integration Test - Jan 16 2026'
steps.actual: Journal entry visible showing 'Anonymous authored wiki article Group Integration Test - Jan 16 2026' posted 3 minutes ago with Like, Read More, Comment options

steps.action: Navigate to article detail page and look for Move option
steps.expected: Move to group option available in article actions
steps.actual: Article detail page shows Edit, History, Delete, Report options but NO Move to group option

issues: Move article between groups feature is not available in the UI. Articles are associated with a group at creation time and cannot be moved to a different group through the UI.

steps.action: Navigate to Groups Directory to find private group
steps.actual: Only one group (Test Activity Group) exists in the system

steps.expected: Verify if group is private or public
steps.actual: Group Edit dialog shows 'Public' is selected. 'Private' option exists but no private groups available to test wiki visibility restrictions.

issues: Cannot test private group wikis because no private group exists in the system. The only available group (Test Activity Group) is configured as Public. Code review confirms private groups are supported via RequireGroupModeViewPermission checks.

observations: Code confirms private group support via RequireGroupModeViewPermission and RequireGroupModeChangePermission methods in ContentController.cs and ListController.cs
Wiki articles are associated with groups via GroupId parameter passed during article creation
Journal integration (AddWikiToJournal) automatically posts wiki article creation to group activity stream
Subscription system allows users to subscribe/unsubscribe from group wiki content notifications
Move article between groups feature does not exist in UI - articles are permanently associated with their creation group
Private group wiki functionality cannot be tested without creating a private group, but code confirms the feature is implemented
User points/scoring system awards points for article creation in groups (observed increase from 218 to 223 points)
